info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 18 at 8:40PM MST until April 18 at 9:45PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... North central Pima County in southeastern Arizona... Southwestern Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 945 PM MST.
* At 840 PM MST, a dust channel was near Picacho, or 20 miles southeast of Casa Grande, moving southeast at 35 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 243. Route 77 between mile markers 86 and 96. Route 79 between mile markers 92 and 128. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 124.
Locations impacted include... Rincon, Saddlebrooke, Jack Rabbit, San Luis - Sells District, Shopishk, Dove Mountain, Palo Verde Stand, Saddlebrooke Ranch, Red Rock, Eloy, Avra Valley, Picacho, Sil Nakya, Silver Bell, Pinal Airpark, Queens Well, North Komelik, Chui-Chu, Marana, and Picacho Peak State Park.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
